content: Is there a way to use the default toolchain with the elan run command? grepping the repo did not find much, I'd like to run elan run default lake build with it

I guess there are some cases in which this would be different from a bare lake build, depending on what you mean by "default", but let me first ask to me sure: Why not just lake build? Assuming lake on your PATH is a symlink to elan, as expected

Mauricio Collares said:

I guess there are some cases in which this would be different from a bare lake build, depending on what you mean by "default", but let me first ask to me sure: Why not just lake build? Assuming lake on your PATH is a symlink to elan, as expected

ah I was not understanding how this works, lake (symmlinked to elan) reads from lean-toolchain right? thanks, I'll declare the default there instead!

If your lake is symlinked to elan, then lake build reads lean-toolchain and uses that. Fun fact: you can still override the toolchain if you prefer, as in lake +leanprover/lean4:v4.3.0 build. The argument is consumed by elan and the "actual" lake doesn't get to see it.
